intro: Stachyarrhena dichroa, commonly known as the two-colored stachyarrhena, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, bilaterally symmetrical flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with trifoliate leaves and yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
